creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
From: "Michael French" <Mike@mpfrench.com>
To: webmaster@apache.org,
              postmaster@apache.org
Date: Thu, 20 Sep 2012 20:59:08 -0500
MIME-Version: 1.0
Subject: Broken Link
Message-ID: <505BC9EC.10189.26C2071@Mike.mpfrench.com>
Priority: normal
X-mailer: Pegasus Mail for Windows (4.63)
Content-type: Multipart/Alternative; boundary="Alt-Boundary-28951.40640625"
X-Virus-Checked: Checked by ClamAV on apache.org

--Alt-Boundary-28951.40640625
Content-type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
Content-transfer-encoding: 7BIT
Content-description: Mail message body

Please tell the person that maintains httpd.apache.org that the link to the Win32 
version of apache 2.2.23 [httpd-2.2.23-win32-x86-openssl-0.9.8t.msi] is broken.

Thanks,
Mike
===============

http://httpd.apache.org/download.cgi#apache22

has links to

 httpd-2.2.23-win32-x86-no_ssl.msi
and
 httpd-2.2.23-win32-x86-openssl-0.9.8t.msi

Both are broken, as are the PGP/hash links, because there is no version of 2.2.23 on the dist folder [1]

[However, there is a stale 2.2.21 release which should be removed]

[1] http://www.apache.org/dist/httpd/binaries/win32/
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 53898 ***
creator: christophe.jaillet@wanadoo.fr
